title: How to Make a Smoky Cheese Ball

methods.name: Making a Classic Smoky Cheese Ball

steps.headline: Shred the smoked cheese.
steps.description: To begin making a classic smoky cheese ball, shred the 2 cups (473.17 ml) of smoked cheese. You can use either cheddar, Swiss or Gouda. Cheddar will give your cheese ball a sharper flavor, whereas Swiss and Gouda will make the cheese ball slightly milder.

steps.headline: Combine the cheeses and butter or margarine.
steps.description: Once you have shredded the smoked cheese, add the smoked cheese, cream cheese and butter or margarine into a large mixing bowl. Mix the ingredients together with an electric mixer or by hand until combined, then let them sit until they reach room temperature.

steps.headline: Add milk and steak sauce and beat until fluffy.
steps.description: Pour in the 2 tablespoons (29.57 ml) milk and 2 teaspoons (9.85 ml) of steak sauce into the mixing bowl and mix with an electric mixer or by hand until the mixture is fluffy, about 2 minutes with an electric mixer and 5 minutes by hand.

steps.headline: Cover and chill the cheese ball for 4-24 hours.
steps.description: Once the mixture is combined and fluffy, place the bowl in the fridge for 4-24 hours. Chilling the cheese mixture will help it get firmer so that it’s easier to shape into a ball.

steps.headline: Shape the mixture into a ball.
steps.description: Once you have chilled the cheese, take the bowl out of the fridge and scoop out the mixture. Use your hands to shape the cheese mixture into a ball.

steps.headline: Roll the cheese ball in nuts and serve.
steps.description: Finely chop 1 cup (240 ml) of pecans or walnuts, then spread the chopped nuts on a cutting board or clean surface. Roll the ball of cheese in the chopped nuts until they coat the surface of the cheese ball. Then serve the cheese ball with pretzels or crackers. If you aren’t serving the cheese ball immediately, put it in the fridge to keep it cool. The cheese ball can be kept in the fridge for up to one week.

steps.headline: Cook the bacon until crisp.
steps.description: A bacon-cheddar cheese ball is a smoky and sharp cheese ball peppered with chunks of crisp bacon. To begin making this cheese ball, cook the bacon in a skillet on the stove for 5-8 minutes or until crisp. Reserve 2 tablespoons (29.57 ml) of the bacon fat in the skillet. To cook the bacon, place the strips in a skillet and place it on the stovetop. Turn the heat up to medium heat. You will see that the bacon begins to release its fat, which will help to cook the bacon and make it crispy. Flip and turn the bacon every minute or so for about 5-8 minutes until it becomes browner and crispy. Then remove the bacon and reserve 2 tablespoons (29.57 ml) of the bacon fat.

steps.headline: Drain and crumble the bacon.
steps.description: After you remove the bacon from the pan, lay down a few layers of paper towels, then place the bacon on top and allow the excess fat to drain off. Then crumble the bacon with your fingers into small pieces.

steps.headline: Chop and sauté the pecans.
steps.description: Chop the ½ cup (120 ml) of pecans on a cutting board. Then heat the 2 tablespoons (29.57 ml) of bacon fat in the skillet and add the chopped pecans. Sauté the pecans for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, the remove them from the skillet and let them cool for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Shred the cheddar cheese and chop the onion.
steps.description: While the nuts are cooling, shred the 2 cups (480 ml) of Cheddar cheese. You can use sharp cheddar cheese or smoked cheddar cheese if you want the flavor of the cheese to compliment the smokiness of the bacon. Chop the green onion into ¼ inch (6.35 mm) rounds.

steps.headline: Combine all the ingredients and shape the cheese into a ball.
steps.description: Place all the ingredients in a large, mixing bowl, then mix them by hand until they are all combined. Once the ingredients are mixed, shape the mixture into a ball.

steps.headline: Wrap the cheese ball in plastic wrap and chill.
steps.description: Once you have formed the cheese into a ball, wrap it in plastic wrap. Store it in the fridge for about 4 hours to let it become firm. Then serve the cheese ball or store it in the fridge for up to one week.

methods.name: Making a Vegan Smoked Cheese and Sage Cheese ball

steps.headline: Sauté the sage leaves in margarine.
steps.description: A vegan smoked cheese and sage cheese ball is a vegan cheese alternative that is just as yummy and flavorful as a traditional cheese ball. To begin making this cheese ball, place the 2 tablespoons (29.57 ml) of dairy-free margarine in a skillet over medium heat. Once the margarine begins to sizzle, drop in the 10 sage leaves and toss them in the margarine. Cook the leaves for a few minutes until they are crispy. Once the leaves are crispy, use a spatula or tongs to take the leaves out of the skillet and place them on a sheet of paper towel to absorb excess oil. Take the skillet of margarine off the heat and allow the margarine to cool.

steps.headline: Toast the pistachios and pumpkin seeds.
steps.description: Turn on your oven to 200 °F (93.3 °C) (93.33 C), then sprinkle the pumpkin seeds and pistachios on a tray. Wait about ten minutes for the oven to preheat, then place the tray of nuts in the oven. Toast the nuts for five minutes, then take them out of the oven.

steps.headline: Shred the cheese and place all ingredients except cranberries in a food processor.
steps.description: Shred the smoked vegan cheese, then add the shredded cheese, vegan cream cheese, salt, sage, pumpkin seeds, pistachios and cooled margarine into a food processor. You also can use a blender, or put everything in a mixing bowl and mix by hand if you don’t have a food processor or blender.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients until combined.
steps.description: Pulse the ingredients in the food processor or blender for a couple seconds, then take off the top and stir. Repeat several times until the mixture is combined. If you are mixing by hand, vigorously mix the ingredients until the mixture is homogenous.

steps.headline: Mold the mixture into a ball and chill for 20 minutes.
steps.description: After you blend the mixture, scoop out the mixture and place it on a sheet of plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Then mold the mixture into a ball and wrap it in the plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Chill the vegan cheese ball in the fridge for 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Chop the dried cranberries and add them to the ball.
steps.description: While the vegan cheese ball is in the fridge, chop the dried cranberries into small pieces. After the cheese ball has chilled for 20 minutes, take it out of the fridge and roll the ball in the dried cranberries. Stick any excess cranberries to the outside of the vegan cheese ball to completely coat it.

steps.headline: Serve or chill the cheese ball.
steps.description: Once the vegan cheese ball has chilled for 20 minutes, take it out of the fridge, unwrap it and serve it alongside vegan crackers and snacks. If you aren’t serving it immediately, keep the ball wrapped the fridge until you are ready to serve it.
